headline: Stocks to Watch Tuesday Recap: Ford Motor, Broadcom, Lennar
summary: ? Ford Motor (F): The automaker expects about $19.5 billion in charges as it scales back electric-vehicle ambitions and shifts focus to gas-powered and hybrid vehicles. Shares closed slightly higher but edged lower after hours.

headline: Heard on the Street Recap: Late Jobs Report Still Leaves a Mark
summary: In a report delayed by the government shutdown, the Labor Department said Tuesday that the unemployment rate rose to 4.6% in November--it’s highest level in more than four years.  The Dow and S&P 500 closed the day in the red, despite gains by most of the megacap tech stocks.  The Dow fell 302 points, or 0.6%.

raw.summary: In a report delayed by the government shutdown, the Labor Department said Tuesday that the unemployment rate rose to 4.6% in November--it’s highest level in more than four years.  The Dow and S&P 500 closed the day in the red, despite gains by most of the megacap tech stocks.  The Dow fell 302 points, or 0.6%.

headline: What Ford’s Massive Charge Means for GM and Toyota
summary: Investors can expect asset write-downs and new plans from auto makers that leaned a little too hard into the trend. Curiously, that shouldn’t be a headwind for their stocks in 2026.

headline: Tesla Stock Rises to First Record of 2025
summary: Shares of EV-maker Tesla rose 3.1% Tuesday to their first record since last December. The price move, which pushed the stock to $489.88, gave the company run by Elon Musk a market cap of $1.629 trillion, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

headline: Why Rivian (RIVN) Shares Are Falling Today
summary: Shares of electric vehicle manufacturer Rivian (NASDAQ:RIVN) fell 5.1% in the afternoon session after its competitor Ford announced a major pullback from its electric vehicle (EV) strategy, which amplified investor concerns about waning consumer demand and the financial health of the EV market.

Ford shares were up 2% ...

headline: How Renault’s Long‑Term Ford EV Supply Deal At Renault (ENXTPA:RNO) Has Changed Its Investment Story
summary: In December 2025, Renault Group and Ford announced a long-term European collaboration under which Renault’s Ampere platform and ElectriCity plants in northern France will develop and build two Ford‑branded electric cars, with the first model expected to reach showrooms in early 2028. The partnership not only deepens Renault’s role as an EV technology and manufacturing supplier, but also explores joint light commercial vehicle development, potentially broadening Renault’s revenue...
